definitions.definition: the scientific study of the mind and how it influences behaviour

examples.text: Kevin has a master's degree in psychology.
She's a professor of psychology at Harvard University.

definitions.definition: the kind of mind that somebody has that makes them think or behave in a particular way

examples.text: I help the actors understand the psychology of their characters.
The answers we give will reflect our own psychology.
Watching the shoppers at the sales gave her a first-hand insight into crowd psychology.

definitions.definition: how the mind influences behaviour in a particular area of life

wordOrigin: late 17th cent.: from modern Latin psychologia (see psycho-, -logy).
